metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22826 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
nextScaffoldPart in xmlparse.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.3 has aninteger overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22826` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.4.3-1
libexpat1 - 2.4.3-1
No subscription required

firefox - 1:1snap1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.3-1').
xmlrpc-c package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
wbxml2 package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
cadaver package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
matanza package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
tdom package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
firefox package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1snap1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
libxmltok package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
